page.title: 14A FUTURE CONCERN, SHERBORNE
page.content: Farmers are facing a difficult time _ animal fats are shunned by the diet- conscious, EEC quotas are imposed to limit over-production, borrowing is expensive. Factory farming is more efficient but is it humane? About 40 million hens are kept 5 to a 20 inch wide cage for egg production, unable to spread their wings. About 500,000 sows stand throughout their lives on cold concrete, 10,000 calves are reared in narrow crates on slatted floors on liquid diet to keep their flesh pale for the white veal trade. Most male chicks are either gassed or crushed when only 1 day old. The scale of misery is massive. Livestock are inefficient converters of protein - peas and beans can prov_ ide the same food value more cheaply and if it can be made more appetising, can solve the world hunger problem.
